expect.name: a

params.name: type
params.descr: The expected type

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

expect.descr: Checks if the type (i.e. tag name) of a specified element is of an expected value.

expect.name: attribute

params.name: attribute
params.descr: The attribute name

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

expect.descr: Checks if a given attribute of an element exists and optionally if it has the expected value.

expect.name: css

params.name: property
params.descr: The css property name

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.*

expect.descr: Checks a given css property of an element exists and optionally if it has the expected value.

expect.name: enabled
expect.descr: Property that checks if an element is currently enabled.

expect.name: present
expect.descr: Property that checks if an element is present in the DOM.

expect.name: selected
expect.descr: Property that checks if an OPTION element, or an INPUT element of type checkbox or radio button is currently selected.

expect.name: text
expect.descr: Property that retrieves the text contained by an element. Can be chained to check if contains/equals/matches the specified text or regex.

expect.name: value
expect.descr: Property that retrieves the value (i.e. the value attributed) of an element. Can be chained to check if contains/equals/matches the specified text or regex.

expect.name: visible
expect.descr: Property that asserts the visibility of a specified element.

protocol.elementinteraction.name: click

params.name: selector
params.descr: The CSS/Xpath selector used to locate the element.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.elementinteraction.descr:
Simulates a click event on the given DOM element. Uses elementIdClick protocol action internally.

The element is scrolled into view if it is not already pointer-interactable. See the WebDriver specification for element interactability
protocol.elementinteraction.more:
Examples

1) Clicking a button

The example below navigates to google.com, searches for the term "nightwatch.js" and clicks the submit button.


module.exports = {
  before : function(browser) {
    // see https://github.com/nightwatchjs/nightwatch/blob/master/examples/globalsModule.js#L12
    browser.globals.waitForConditionTimeout = 5000;
  },

  'click example test' : function (browser) {

    browser
      .url('https://google.com')
      .waitForElementVisible('input[type=text]')
      .setValue('input[type=text]', 'nightwatch.js')
      .click('button[type=submit]', function(result) {
        this.assert.strictEqual(result.status, 0);
      })
      .expect.element('#rcnt').text.to.contain('nightwatchjs.org/');
  },

  after : function(browser) {
    browser.end();
  }
};

Output

[Click] Test Suite
======================

Running:  clearValue example test
 ✔ Element  was visible after 67 milliseconds.
 ✔ Passed [strictEqual]: 0 === 0
 ✔ Expected element <#rcnt> text to contain: "nightwatchjs.org/" - condition was met in 768ms

OK. 3 assertions passed. (5.277s)

2) Selecting an option from a list

The click command is also used to select an option from a drop down list. The example below navigates to https://www.w3.org and selects the "All" option from the regions drop down.


module.exports = {
  before : function(browser) {
    // see https://github.com/nightwatchjs/nightwatch/blob/master/examples/globalsModule.js#L12
    browser.globals.waitForConditionTimeout = 5000;
  },

  'click option from drop down list' : function (browser) {

    browser
      .url('https://www.w3.org/')
      .waitForElementVisible('#region_form')
      .click('#region_form select')
      .click('#region_form select option[value="all"]')
      .click('input[type=submit]', function(result) {
        this.assert.strictEqual(result.status, 0);
      });
  },

  after : function(browser) {
    browser.end();
  }
};

Output

[Click Options] Test Suite
==============================

Running:  click option from drop down list
 ✔ Element <#region_form> was visible after 64 milliseconds.
 ✔ Passed [strictEqual]: 0 === 0

OK. 2 assertions passed. (6.203s)

Possible Errors

  • element not visible - if the referenced element is not visible on the page (either hidden by CSS, has 0-width, or has 0-height or it is not within the viewport).

Full error details are available when running nightwatch with --verbose flag.

protocol.elementinteraction.name: clearValue

params.name: selector
params.descr: The CSS/Xpath selector used to locate the element.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.elementinteraction.descr: Clear a textarea or a text input element's value. Uses elementIdValue protocol action internally.
protocol.elementinteraction.more:
Examples

The example below navigates to google.com, searches for the term "nightwatch.js", then clears the input using clearValue command and finally verifies if the results container is empty:


module.exports = {
  before : function(browser) {
    // see https://github.com/nightwatchjs/nightwatch/blob/master/examples/globalsModule.js#L12
    browser.globals.waitForConditionTimeout = 5000;
  },

  'clearValue example test' : function (browser) {

    browser
      .url('https://google.com')
      .waitForElementVisible('input[type=text]')
      .setValue('input[type=text]', 'nightwatch.js')
      .click('button[type=submit]')
      .expect.element('#rcnt').text.to.contain('nightwatchjs.org/');

    browser
      .clearValue('input[type=text]')
      .expect.element('#rcnt').text.to.equal('');
  },

  after : function(browser) {
    browser.end();
  }
};

Output

[Clear Value] Test Suite
============================

Running:  clearValue example test
 ✔ Element  was visible after 68 milliseconds.
 ✔ Expected element <#rcnt> text to contain: "nightwatchjs.org/" - condition was met in 763ms
 ✔ Expected element <#rcnt> text to equal: "" - condition was met in 36ms

OK. 3 assertions passed. (7.593s)

Possible Errors

Here are the type of errors that you might get when using clearValue. Full error details are available when running nightwatch with --verbose flag.

  • invalid element state - if the referenced element is disabled or is not displayed.
  • element not visible - if the referenced element is not visible on the page (either is hidden by CSS, has 0-width, or has 0-height)

protocol.elementinteraction.name: moveToElement

params.name: selector
params.descr: The CSS/Xpath selector used to locate the element.

params.name: xoffset
params.descr: X offset to move to, relative to the top-left corner of the element.

params.name: yoffset
params.descr: Y offset to move to, relative to the top-left corner of the element.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.elementinteraction.descr: Move the mouse by an offset of the specified element. Uses moveTo protocol command.

protocol.elementinteraction.name: setValue

params.name: selector
params.descr: The CSS/Xpath selector used to locate the element.

params.name: inputValue
params.descr: The text to send to the element or key strokes.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.elementinteraction.descr:
Sends some text to an element. Can be used to set the value of a form element or to send a sequence of key strokes to an element. Any UTF-8 character may be specified.

setValue does not clear the existing value of the element. To do so, use the clearValue() command.

An object map with available keys and their respective UTF-8 characters, as defined on W3C WebDriver draft spec, is loaded onto the main Nightwatch instance as browser.Keys.

protocol.elementinteraction.name: submitForm

params.name: selector
params.descr: The CSS/Xpath selector used to locate the element.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.elementinteraction.descr: Submit a FORM element. The submit command may also be applied to any element that is a descendant of a FORM element. Uses submit protocol command.

protocol.elementinteraction.name: elementIdClear

params.name: id
params.descr: The web element ID of the element to route the command to.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.elementinteraction.descr: Scrolls into view a submittable element excluding buttons or editable element, and then attempts to clear its value, reset the checked state, or text content.

protocol.elementinteraction.name: elementIdClick

params.name: id
params.descr: The web element ID of the element to route the command to.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.elementinteraction.descr: Scrolls into view the element and clicks the in-view center point. If the element is not pointer-interactable, an element not interactable error is returned.

protocol.elementinteraction.name: elementIdValue

params.name: id
params.descr: The web element ID of the element to route the command to.

params.name: value
params.descr: Value to send to element in case of a POST

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.elementinteraction.descr: Scrolls into view the form control element and then sends the provided keys to the element, or returns the current value of the element. In case the element is not keyboard interactable, an element not interactable error is returned.

protocol.elementinteraction.name: keys

params.name: keysToSend
params.descr: The keys sequence to be sent.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.elementinteraction.descr:
Send a sequence of key strokes to the active element. The sequence is defined in the same format as the sendKeys command.
An object map with available keys and their respective UTF-8 characters, as defined on W3C WebDriver draft spec, is loaded onto the main Nightwatch instance as client.Keys.

Rather than the setValue, the modifiers are not released at the end of the call. The state of the modifier keys is kept between calls, so mouse interactions can be performed while modifier keys are depressed.

protocol.elementinteraction.name: submit

params.name: id
params.descr: The web element ID of the element to route the command to.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.elementinteraction.descr: Submit a FORM element. The submit command may also be applied to any element that is a descendant of a FORM element.

params.name: attribute

protocol.elementstate.name: getValue

params.name: selector

params.name: callback

protocol.elementstate.descr: Returns a form element current value. Uses elementIdValue protocol command.

protocol.elementstate.name: isVisible

params.name: selector

params.name: callback

protocol.elementstate.descr: Determine if an element is currently displayed. Uses elementIdDisplayed protocol command.

params.name: callback

params.name: attributeName

params.name: callback

Retrieve the computed value of the given CSS property of the given element.

The CSS property to query should be specified using the CSS property name, not the JavaScript property name (e.g. background-color instead of backgroundColor).

params.name: callback

protocol.elementlocation.name: getLocation

params.name: selector
params.descr: The CSS/Xpath selector used to locate the element.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.elementlocation.descr:
Determine an element's location on the page. The point (0, 0) refers to the upper-left corner of the page.

The element's coordinates are returned as a JSON object with x and y properties. Uses elementIdLocation protocol command.

returns.descr: The X and Y coordinates for the element on the page.

protocol.elementlocation.name: getLocationInView

params.name: selector
params.descr: The CSS/Xpath selector used to locate the element.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.elementlocation.descr: Determine an element's location on the screen once it has been scrolled into view. Uses elementIdLocationInView protocol command.

returns.descr: The X and Y coordinates for the element on the page.

protocol.elementlocation.name: elementIdLocationInView

params.name: id
params.descr: The web element ID of the element to route the command to.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.elementlocation.descr: Determine an element's location on the screen once it has been scrolled into view.

protocol.elementlocation.name: elementIdLocation

params.name: id
params.descr: The web element ID of the element to route the command to.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.elementlocation.descr:
Determine an element's location on the page. The point (0, 0) refers to the upper-left corner of the page.

The element's coordinates are returned as a JSON object with x and y properties.

returns.descr: The X and Y coordinates for the element on the page.

protocol.contexts.name: switchWindow

params.name: handleOrName
params.descr: The server assigned window handle or the name attribute.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.contexts.descr:
Change focus to another window. The window to change focus to may be specified by its server assigned window handle, or by the value of its name attribute.

To find out the window handle use windowHandles command

params.name: width
params.descr: The new window width.

params.name: height
params.descr: The new window height.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

params.name: offsetX
params.descr: The new window offset x-position.

params.name: offsetY
params.descr: The new window offset y-position.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.contexts.name: closeWindow

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.contexts.descr:
Close the current window. This can be useful when you're working with multiple windows open (e.g. an OAuth login).
Uses window protocol command.

protocol.contexts.name: window

params.name: method
params.descr: The HTTP method to use. Can be either POST (change focus) or DELETE (close window).

params.name: handleOrName
params.descr: The window to change focus to.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.contexts.descr: Change focus to another window or close the current window. Shouldn't normally be used directly, instead .switchWindow() and .closeWindow() should be used.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.contexts.name: windowHandles

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.contexts.descr: Retrieve the list of all window handles available to the session.

protocol.contexts.name: windowMaximize

params.name: handleOrName
params.descr: windowHandle URL parameter; if it is "current", the currently active window will be maximized.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.contexts.descr: Increases the window to the maximum available size without going full-screen.

protocol.contexts.name: windowPosition

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.contexts.descr: Change or get the position of the specified window. If the second argument is a function it will be used as a callback and the call will perform a get request to retrieve the existing window position.

protocol.contexts.name: windowSize

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.contexts.descr: Change or get the size of the specified window. If the second argument is a function it will be used as a callback and the call will perform a get request to retrieve the existing window size.

protocol.contexts.name: frame

params.name: frameId
params.descr: Identifier for the frame to change focus to.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.contexts.descr: Change focus to another frame on the page. If the frame id is missing or null, the server should switch to the page's default content.

protocol.contexts.name: frameParent

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.contexts.descr: Change focus to the parent context. If the current context is the top level browsing context, the context remains unchanged.

protocol.screens.name: saveScreenshot

params.name: fileName
params.descr: The complete path to the file name where the screenshot should be saved.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.screens.descr: Take a screenshot of the current page and saves it as the given filename.

protocol.screens.name: screenshot

params.name: log_screenshot_data
params.descr: Whether or not the screenshot data should appear in the logs when running with --verbose

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.screens.descr: Take a screenshot of the current page.

protocol.navigation.name: getTitle

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.navigation.descr: Returns the title of the current page. Uses title protocol command.

returns.descr: The page title.

protocol.navigation.name: init

params.name: url
params.descr: Url to navigate to.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.navigation.descr:
This command is an alias to url and also a convenience method when called without any arguments in the sense that it performs a call to .url() with passing the value of launch_url field from the settings file.
Uses url protocol command.

protocol.navigation.name: urlHash

params.name: hash
params.descr: The hash to add/replace to the current url (i.e. the value set in the launch_url property in nightwatch.json).

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.navigation.descr: Convenience method that adds the specified hash (i.e. url fragment) to the current value of the launch_url as set in nightwatch.json.

protocol.navigation.name: url

params.name: url
params.descr: If missing, it will return the URL of the current page as an argument to the supplied callback.

protocol.navigation.descr: Retrieve the URL of the current page or navigate to a new URL.

protocol.navigation.name: back

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.navigation.descr: Navigate backwards in the browser history, if possible.

protocol.navigation.name: forward

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.navigation.descr: Navigate forwards in the browser history, if possible.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.cookies.name: getCookies

params.name: callback
params.descr: The callback function which will receive the response as an argument.

protocol.cookies.descr:
Retrieve all cookies visible to the current page. The cookies are returned as an array of cookie JSON object, as defined here.

Uses cookie protocol command.

returns.descr: A list of cookies.

protocol.cookies.name: getCookie

params.name: name
params.descr: The cookie name.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.cookies.descr:
Retrieve a single cookie visible to the current page. The cookie is returned as a cookie JSON object, as defined here.

Uses cookie protocol command.

returns.descr: The cookie object as a selenium cookie JSON object or null if the cookie wasn't found.

protocol.cookies.name: setCookie

params.name: cookie
params.descr: The cookie object.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.cookies.descr:
Set a cookie, specified as a cookie JSON object, as defined here.

Uses cookie protocol command.

protocol.cookies.name: deleteCookie

params.name: cookieName
params.descr: The name of the cookie to delete.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.cookies.descr: Delete the cookie with the given name. This command is a no-op if there is no such cookie visible to the current page.

protocol.cookies.name: deleteCookies

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.cookies.descr: Delete all cookies visible to the current page.

protocol.cookies.name: cookie

params.name: method
params.descr: Http method

params.name: callbackOrCookie
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.cookies.descr: Retrieve or delete all cookies visible to the current page or set a cookie. Normally this shouldn't be used directly, instead the cookie convenience methods should be used: getCookie, getCookies, setCookie, deleteCookie, deleteCookies.

protocol.document.name: injectScript

params.name: scriptUrl
params.descr: The script file url

params.name: id
params.descr: Dom element id to be set on the script tag.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.document.descr: Utility command to load an external script into the page specified by url.

returns.descr: The newly created script tag.

protocol.document.name: source

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.document.descr: Returns a string serialisation of the DOM of the current page.

protocol.document.name: execute

params.name: body
params.descr: The function body to be injected.

params.name: args
params.descr: An array of arguments which will be passed to the function.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.document.descr:
Inject a snippet of JavaScript into the page for execution in the context of the currently selected frame. The executed script is assumed to be synchronous.
The script argument defines the script to execute in the form of a function body. The value returned by that function will be returned to the client.

The function will be invoked with the provided args array and the values may be accessed via the arguments object in the order specified.

Under the hood, if the body param is a function it is converted to a string with <function>.toString(). Any references to your current scope are ignored.

To ensure cross-browser compatibility, the specified function should not be in ES6 format (i.e. () => {}). If the execution of the function fails, the first argument of the callback contains error information.

returns.descr: The script result.

protocol.document.name: executeAsync

params.name: script
params.descr: The function body to be injected.

params.name: args
params.descr: An array of arguments which will be passed to the function.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.document.descr:
Inject a snippet of JavaScript into the page for execution in the context of the currently selected frame. The executed script is assumed to be asynchronous.

The function to be injected receives the done callback as argument which needs to be called when the asynchronous operation finishes. The value passed to the done callback is returned to the client.
Additional arguments for the injected function may be passed as a non-empty array which will be passed before the done callback.

Asynchronous script commands may not span page loads. If an unload event is fired while waiting for the script result, an error will be returned.

returns.descr: The script result.

protocol.document.more:
Example


module.exports = {
  before : function(browser) {
    // see https://github.com/nightwatchjs/nightwatch/blob/master/examples/globalsModule.js#L12
    browser.globals.waitForConditionTimeout = 5000;
  },

  'executeAsync example test' : function (browser) {

    browser
      .timeoutsAsyncScript(10000)
      .executeAsync(function (inputVal, done) {
          // ... do stuff with window ...
          setTimeout(done, 5000, 'result');
        },
        ['input'],
        function (resultVal) {
          console.log('result =', resultVal);
        }
      );
  },

  after : function(browser) {
    browser.end();
  }
};

protocol.sessions.name: getLogTypes

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.sessions.descr: Gets the available log types. More info about log types in WebDriver can be found here: https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/wiki/Logging

returns.descr: Available log types

protocol.sessions.name: getLog

params.name: typeString
params.descr: Log type to request

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.sessions.name: isLogAvailable

params.name: typeString
params.descr: Type of log to test

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.sessions.descr: Utility command to test if the log type is available.

protocol.sessions.name: end

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.sessions.descr: Ends the session. Uses session protocol command.
protocol.sessions.more:
Overview

Behind the scenes, the end commands sends a DELETE request to the WebDriver server, passing the current sessionId property. After the DELETE is done, the sessionId is null-ed.

If the sessionId is not set, the callback is invoked right away and complete event is signaled.

Taking screenshots on failures/errors

If test failures or errors exist and screenshots are enabled, then screenshots are taken prior to sending the DELETE.

To enable screenshots for test failures/errors, set the screenshots property in your nightwatch.json, under the desired test_settings environment. E.g.:


{
  "test_settings" : {
    "default" : {
      "screenshots" : {
        "enabled" : true,
        "on_failure" : true,
        "path" : "./screens"
      }
    }
  }
}

protocol.sessions.name: session

params.name: action
params.descr: The http verb to use, can be "get", "post" or "delete". If only the callback is passed, get is assumed by default.

params.name: sessionId
params.descr: The id of the session to get info about or delete.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.sessions.descr: Get info about, delete or create a new session. Defaults to the current session.

protocol.sessions.name: sessions

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.sessions.descr: Returns a list of the currently active sessions.

protocol.sessions.name: timeouts

params.name: type
params.descr: The type of operation to set the timeout for. Valid values are "script" for script timeouts, "implicit" for modifying the implicit wait timeout and "page load" for setting a page load timeout.

params.name: ms
params.descr: The amount of time, in milliseconds, that time-limited commands are permitted to run.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.sessions.descr: Configure the amount of time that a particular type of operation can execute for before they are aborted and a |Timeout| error is returned to the client.

protocol.sessions.name: timeoutsAsyncScript

params.name: ms
params.descr: The amount of time, in milliseconds, that time-limited commands are permitted to run.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.sessions.descr: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, that asynchronous scripts executed by .executeAsync are permitted to run before they are aborted and a |Timeout| error is returned to the client.

protocol.sessions.name: timeoutsImplicitWait

params.name: ms
params.descr: The amount of time, in milliseconds, that time-limited commands are permitted to run.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.sessions.descr: Set the amount of time the driver should wait when searching for elements. If this command is never sent, the driver will default to an implicit wait of 0ms.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.sessions.name: sessionLog

params.name: typeString
params.descr: Type of log to request. Can be one of: client, driver, browser, server

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.sessions.descr:
Gets the text of the log type specified. To find out the available log types, use .getLogTypes().

Returns a log entry JSON object.

returns.descr: Array of the text entries of the log.

protocol.sessions.name: sessionLogTypes

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.sessions.descr: Gets an array of strings for which log types are available. This methods returns the entire WebDriver response, if you are only interested in the logs array, use .getLogTypes() instead.

protocol.utilities.name: pause

params.name: ms
params.descr: The number of milliseconds to wait.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.utilities.descr: Suspends the test for the given time in milliseconds. If the milliseconds argument is missing it will suspend the test indefinitely

protocol.utilities.name: useCss

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.utilities.descr: Sets the locate strategy for selectors to css selector, therefore every following selector needs to be specified as css.

protocol.utilities.name: useXpath

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.utilities.descr: Sets the locate strategy for selectors to xpath, therefore every following selector needs to be specified as xpath.

protocol.utilities.name: perform

params.name: callback
params.descr: The function to run as part of the queue.

protocol.utilities.descr:
A simple perform command which allows access to the Nightwatch API in a callback. Can be useful if you want to read variables set by other commands.

The callback signature can have up to two parameters.

  • no parameters: callback runs and perform completes immediately at the end of the execution of the callback.
  • one parameter: allows for asynchronous execution within the callback providing a done callback function for completion as the first argument.
  • two parameters: allows for asynchronous execution with the Nightwatch api object passed in as the first argument, followed by the done callback.

protocol.elements.name: waitForElementVisible

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: time=waitForConditionTimeout
params.descr: The total number of milliseconds to wait before failing.

params.name: poll=waitForConditionPollInterval
params.descr: The number of milliseconds to wait between checks. You can use this only if you also specify the time parameter.

params.name: abortOnFailure=abortOnAssertionFailure
params.descr: By the default if the element is not found the test will fail. Set this to false if you wish for the test to continue even if the assertion fails. To set this globally you can define a property abortOnAssertionFailure in your globals.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional message to be shown in the output; the message supports two placeholders: %s for current selector and %d for the time (e.g. Element %s was not in the page for %d ms).

protocol.elements.descr:
Waits a given time in milliseconds for an element to be visible in the page before performing any other commands or assertions.

If the element fails to be present and visible in the specified amount of time, the test fails. You can change this by setting abortOnFailure to false.

You can change the polling interval by defining a waitForConditionPollInterval property (in milliseconds) in as a global property in your nightwatch.json or in your external globals file.

Similarly, a default timeout can be specified as a global waitForConditionTimeout property (in milliseconds).

protocol.elements.name: waitForElementNotVisible

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: time=waitForConditionTimeout
params.descr: The total number of milliseconds to wait before failing.

params.name: poll=waitForConditionPollInterval
params.descr: The number of milliseconds to wait between checks. You can use this only if you also specify the time parameter.

params.name: abortOnFailure=abortOnAssertionFailure
params.descr: By the default if the element is not found the test will fail. Set this to false if you wish for the test to continue even if the assertion fails. To set this globally you can define a property abortOnAssertionFailure in your globals.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional message to be shown in the output; the message supports two placeholders: %s for current selector and %d for the time (e.g. Element %s was not in the page for %d ms).

protocol.elements.descr:
Opposite of waitForElementVisible. Waits a given time in milliseconds for an element to be not visible (i.e. hidden but existing) in the page before performing any other commands or assertions.

If the element fails to be hidden in the specified amount of time, the test fails.

You can change the polling interval by defining a waitForConditionPollInterval property (in milliseconds) in as a global property in your nightwatch.json or in your external globals file.

Similarly, a default timeout can be specified as a global waitForConditionTimeout property (in milliseconds).

protocol.elements.name: waitForElementPresent

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: time=waitForConditionTimeout
params.descr: The total number of milliseconds to wait before failing.

params.name: poll=waitForConditionPollInterval
params.descr: The number of milliseconds to wait between checks. You can use this only if you also specify the time parameter.

params.name: abortOnFailure=abortOnAssertionFailure
params.descr: By the default if the element is not found the test will fail. Set this to false if you wish for the test to continue even if the assertion fails. To set this globally you can define a property abortOnAssertionFailure in your globals.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional message to be shown in the output; the message supports two placeholders: %s for current selector and %d for the time (e.g. Element %s was not in the page for %d ms).

protocol.elements.descr:
Waits a given time in milliseconds for an element to be present in the page before performing any other commands or assertions.

If the element fails to be present in the specified amount of time, the test fails. You can change this by setting abortOnFailure to false.

You can change the polling interval by defining a waitForConditionPollInterval property (in milliseconds) in as a global property in your nightwatch.json or in your external globals file.

Similarly, a default timeout can be specified as a global waitForConditionTimeout property (in milliseconds).

protocol.elements.name: waitForElementNotPresent

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: time=waitForConditionTimeout
params.descr: The total number of milliseconds to wait before failing.

params.name: poll=waitForConditionPollInterval
params.descr: The number of milliseconds to wait between checks. You can use this only if you also specify the time parameter.

params.name: abortOnFailure=abortOnAssertionFailure
params.descr: By the default if the element is not found the test will fail. Set this to false if you wish for the test to continue even if the assertion fails. To set this globally you can define a property abortOnAssertionFailure in your globals.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional message to be shown in the output; the message supports two placeholders: %s for current selector and %d for the time (e.g. Element %s was not in the page for %d ms).

protocol.elements.descr:
Opposite of waitForElementPresent. Waits a given time in milliseconds for an element to be not present (i.e. removed) in the page before performing any other commands or assertions.

If the element is still present after the specified amount of time, the test fails.

You can change the polling interval by defining a waitForConditionPollInterval property (in milliseconds) in as a global property in your nightwatch.json or in your external globals file.

Similarly, a default timeout can be specified as a global waitForConditionTimeout property (in milliseconds).

protocol.elements.name: element

params.name: using
params.descr: The locator strategy to use.

params.name: value
params.descr: The search target.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.elements.descr:
Search for an element on the page, starting from the document root. The located element will be returned as a web element JSON object.
First argument to be passed is the locator strategy, which is detailed on the WebDriver docs.

protocol.elements.name: elements

params.name: using
params.descr: The locator strategy to use.

params.name: value
params.descr: The search target.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function to be invoked with the result when the command finishes.

protocol.elements.descr:
Search for multiple elements on the page, starting from the document root. The located elements will be returned as web element JSON objects.
First argument to be passed is the locator strategy, which is detailed on the WebDriver docs.

protocol.elements.name: elementIdEquals

params.name: id
params.descr: The web element ID of the element to route the command to.

params.name: otherId
params.descr: The web element ID of the other element to compare against.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.elements.descr: Test if two element IDs refer to the same DOM element.

protocol.elements.name: elementIdElement

params.name: id
params.descr: The web element ID of the element to route the command to.

params.name: using
params.descr: The locator strategy to use.

params.name: value
params.descr: The search target.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.elements.descr: Search for an element on the page, starting from the identified element. The located element will be returned as a web element JSON object.

protocol.elements.name: elementIdElements

params.name: id
params.descr: The web element ID of the element to route the command to.

params.name: using
params.descr: The locator strategy to use.

params.name: value
params.descr: The search target.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.elements.descr: Search for multiple elements on the page, starting from the identified element. The located element will be returned as a web element JSON objects.

assertions.name: attributeContains

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: attribute
params.descr: The attribute name

params.name: expected
params.descr: The expected contained value of the attribute to check.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the given attribute of an element contains the expected value.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.attributeContains('#someElement', 'href', 'google.com');
   };

assertions.name: attributeEquals

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: attribute
params.descr: The attribute name

params.name: expected
params.descr: The expected value of the attribute to check.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the given attribute of an element has the expected value.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.attributeEquals('body', 'data-attr', 'some value');
   };

assertions.name: containsText

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: expectedText
params.descr: The text to look for.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the given element contains the specified text.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.containsText('#main', 'The Night Watch');
   };

assertions.name: cssClassNotPresent

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: className
params.descr: The CSS class to look for.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the given element does not have the specified CSS class.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.cssClassNotPresent('#main', 'container');
   };

assertions.name: cssClassPresent

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: className
params.descr: The CSS class to look for.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the given element has the specified CSS class.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.cssClassPresent('#main', 'container');
   };

assertions.name: cssProperty

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: cssProperty
params.descr: The CSS property.

params.name: expected
params.descr: The expected value of the css property to check.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the specified css property of a given element has the expected value.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.cssProperty('#main', 'display', 'block');
   };

assertions.name: elementNotPresent

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the given element exists in the DOM.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.elementNotPresent(".should_not_exist");
   };

assertions.name: elementPresent

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the given element exists in the DOM.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.elementPresent("#main");
   };

assertions.name: hidden

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the given element is not visible on the page.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.hidden(".should_not_be_visible");
   };

assertions.name: title

params.name: expected
params.descr: The expected page title.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the page title equals the given value.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.title("Nightwatch.js");
   };

assertions.name: urlContains

params.name: expected
params.descr: The value expected to exist within the current URL.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the current URL contains the given value.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.urlContains('google');
   };

assertions.name: urlEquals

params.name: expected
params.descr: The expected url.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the current url equals the given value.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.urlEquals('http://www.google.com');
   };

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: expectedText
params.descr: The expected text.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the given form element's value equals the expected value.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.value("form.login input[type=text]", "username");
   };

params.name: selector

params.name: expectedText

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the given form element's value contains the expected value.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.valueContains("form.login input[type=text]", "username");
   };

params.name: selector
params.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element.

params.name: message
params.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr:
Checks if the given element is visible on the page.

   this.demoTest = function (client) {
     browser.assert.visible(".should_be_visible");
   };

protocol.useractions.name: doubleClick

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.useractions.descr: Double-clicks at the current mouse coordinates (set by .moveto()).

protocol.useractions.name: mouseButtonClick

params.name: button
params.descr: The mouse button

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.useractions.descr:
Click at the current mouse coordinates (set by moveto).

The button can be (0, 1, 2) or ('left', 'middle', 'right'). It defaults to left mouse button.

protocol.useractions.name: mouseButtonDown

params.name: button
params.descr: The mouse button

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.useractions.descr:
Click and hold the left mouse button (at the coordinates set by the last moveto command). Note that the next mouse-related command that should follow is mouseButtonUp . Any other mouse command (such as click or another call to buttondown) will yield undefined behaviour.

Can be used for implementing drag-and-drop. The button can be (0, 1, 2) or ('left', 'middle', 'right'). It defaults to left mouse button, and if you don't pass in a button but do pass in a callback, it will handle it correctly.

protocol.useractions.name: mouseButtonUp

params.name: button
params.descr: The mouse button

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.useractions.descr:
Releases the mouse button previously held (where the mouse is currently at). Must be called once for every mouseButtonDown command issued.

Can be used for implementing drag-and-drop. The button can be (0, 1, 2) or ('left', 'middle', 'right'). It defaults to left mouse button, and if you don't pass in a button but do pass in a callback, it will handle it correctly.

protocol.useractions.name: moveTo

params.name: element
params.descr: The web element ID assigned to the element to move to. If not specified or is null, the offset is relative to current position of the mouse.

params.name: xoffset
params.descr: X offset to move to, relative to the top-left corner of the element. If not specified, the mouse will move to the middle of the element.

params.name: yoffset
params.descr: Y offset to move to, relative to the top-left corner of the element. If not specified, the mouse will move to the middle of the element.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.useractions.descr:
Move the mouse by an offset of the specified element. If no element is specified, the move is relative to the current mouse cursor. If an element is provided but no offset, the mouse will be moved to the center of the element.

If the element is not visible, it will be scrolled into view.

protocol.userprompts.name: acceptAlert

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.userprompts.descr: Accepts the currently displayed alert dialog. Usually, this is equivalent to clicking on the 'OK' button in the dialog.

protocol.userprompts.name: dismissAlert

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.userprompts.descr:
Dismisses the currently displayed alert dialog. For confirm() and prompt() dialogs, this is equivalent to clicking the 'Cancel' button.

For alert() dialogs, this is equivalent to clicking the 'OK' button.

protocol.userprompts.name: getAlertText

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

protocol.userprompts.descr: Gets the text of the currently displayed JavaScript alert(), confirm(), or prompt() dialog.

returns.descr: The text of the currently displayed alert.

protocol.userprompts.name: setAlertText

params.name: value
params.descr: Keystrokes to send to the prompt() dialog

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.userprompts.descr: Sends keystrokes to a JavaScript prompt() dialog.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function which is called with the result value.

params.name: orientation
params.descr: The new browser orientation: {LANDSCAPE|PORTRAIT}

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.mobile.name: contexts

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function to be called when the command finishes.

protocol.mobile.descr:
Get a list of the available contexts.

Used by Appium when testing hybrid mobile web apps. More info here: https://github.com/appium/appium/blob/master/docs/en/advanced-concepts/hybrid.md.

returns.descr: an array of strings representing available contexts, e.g 'WEBVIEW', or 'NATIVE'

params.name: callback
params.descr: Callback function to be called when the command finishes.

returns.descr: a string representing the current context or `null`, representing "no context"

params.name: context
params.descr: context name to switch to - a string representing an available context.

params.name: callback
params.descr: Optional callback function to be called when the command finishes.
